intro: Peucedanum makinoi, commonly known as Japanese cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
